intro: Phyllanthus sandwicensis var. ellipticus, commonly known as the Hawaiian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food and shelter for various native insects and birds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is protected in its native range.
